title: Showery weather condition to enhance in next few days
byline: Due to the influence of the active southwest monsoon weather condition, showery weather over the Western, and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle, Matara, Nuwara-Eliya and Kandy districts is likely to enhance during the next few days, the Meteorology Department says.

title: Trains along coastal line delayed
byline: Train services along the coastal line are experiencing delays due to a train traveling from Galle to Maradana breaking down near the Ambalangoda railway station.

title: Three Sri Lankans attempting to cross Albania border with forged documents arrested
byline: Three Sri Lankans have been arrested by Police in Albania for allegedly attempting to cross the Qafë Thana border with forged documents.

title: Car ploughs into fans at Liverpool parade, 27 in hospital
byline: A car ploughed into a crowd of Liverpool fans during a parade celebrating their side’s Premier League soccer title on Monday, hospitalising 27 people, with two seriously injured, but police said they did not believe the incident was terrorism-related.

title: Sri Lanka on track to roll out e-NIC, Thales delivering final 400k cards
byline: The final 400,000 polycarbonate cards procured from Thales by Sri Lanka’s Department of Registration of Persons to implement the Electronic National Identity Card (e-NIC) project will be delivered by the end of June, M.S.P. Suriyapperuma, director general of the Department of Registration of Persons, told Biometric Update.

title: Legal action against candidates who fail to submit campaign finance reports, EC Chief warns
byline: Legal action will be taken against Local Government (LG) election candidates who fail to submit their financial disclosures in line with the provisions of the Election Expenditure Regulation Act No. 03 of 2023, Chairman of the Election Commission R.M.A.L. Rathnayake has said.

title: Supplementary Medical Professionals to launch strike today
byline: The officials of the medical laboratory services and physiotherapists, who are affiliated with the Supplementary Medical Service, have decided to commence a strike action from 8.00 a.m. today (27), based on five demands.

title: Tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka surpass 1 million in 2025
byline: The total number of tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka in 2025 has surpassed one million.

title: American Music Awards Winners 2025: Billie Eilish sweeps all seven nominated categories
byline: Billie Eilish, Beyoncé and Eminem were just a few of the big winners during the American Music Awards 2025, produced by Dick Clark Productions and broadcast from Las Vegas.

title: Private Member’s Bill to be tabled to amend PC Elections Act
byline: A Private Member’s Bill is scheduled to be tabled in Parliament to amend the Provincial Councils Elections Act (No. 2 of 1988).

title: Over 1,000 killed, nearly 7,000 injured in road accidents in 2025
byline: A total of 1,062 individuals have been killed in 1,003 fatal road accidents so far this year as of May 25, 2025, Police Media Spokesman SSP Buddhika Manatunga stated.

title: Landslide warnings issued for several areas in four districts
byline: Early landslide warnings have been issued for multiple areas in four districts as heavy rainfall continues in parts of the island.

title: Assistant Controller of Immigration Dept arrested for issuing three passports for ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’
byline: An Assistant Controller of the Department of Immigration and Emigration has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) for allegedly issuing three forged passports for underworld kingpin Mandinu Padmasiri alias ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’, Police said.

title: Chinese-owned Volvo Cars to cut 3,000 jobs
byline: Sweden-based car maker Volvo Cars says it will cut around 3,000 jobs as part of its cost-cutting measures.

title: Sri Lanka and New Zealand discuss ways to deepen bilateral trade and investment ties
byline: Debt-stricken Sri Lanka hosted one of New Zealand’s top ministers to discuss ways to deepen bilateral ties in areas such as trade, tourism and agriculture.

title: Cabinet nod to recruit over 15,000 individuals to public service
byline: A proposal to fill 15,073 vacancies in the public service has been approved by the Cabinet of Ministers.

title: ‘Chikungunya’ cases detected in Colombo and Gampaha, likely to spread in other regions
byline: A warning has been issued by the Epidemiology Unit of the Ministry of Health regarding the potential spread of Chikungunya in several regions across the country.

title: Pakistan PM signals intent for peace talks with India
byline: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif, during his visit to Iran has expressed openness to holding peace talks with India “to resolve all issues,” including Kashmir, terrorism, water disputes, and trade, according to PTI.

title: Miss World 2025: Miss Indonesia also wins Beauty With a Purpose
byline: Hyderabad lit up with hope, purpose, and celebration as the Miss World 2025 ‘Beauty With a Purpose’ Dinner Gala took center stage on Monday.

title: Sri Lanka closely monitoring emergence of new COVID variant: Minister
byline: Cabinet Spokesperson Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa says the government is closely monitoring the emergence of a new COVID-19 variant that is spreading in several countries worldwide, including neighbouring India.

title: Assistant Immigration Controller remanded over issuing passports for ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’
byline: An Assistant Controller of the Department of Immigration and Emigration, who was arrested for allegedly issuing three forged passports for underworld kingpin Mandinu Padmasiri alias ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’, has been ordered to be remand in custody until May 29, 2025.

title: Fire breaks out in a shop in Rajagiriya
byline: A fire has reportedly broken out in a shop in Rajagiriya.

title: Nepal’s ‘Everest Man’ sets record with 31st summit
byline: Nepali sherpa Kami Rita, also known as “Everest Man”, has scaled Mount Everest for the 31st time, breaking his own record for the most climbs up the world’s tallest peak.

title: Weather advisory issued for heavy rainfall
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an ‘Amber’ level advisory for heavy rains in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle, Matara, Nuwara-Eliya, and Kandy districts, valid for the next 24 hours.

title: National Security Council to review MPs’ security requests - Acting IGP
byline: Requests by Members of Parliament to increase their respective security detail will be forwarded to the National Security Council for consideration, Acting Inspector General of Police Priyantha Weerasuriya has said.

title: ‘Tourist Family’: Kollywood movie inspired by Sri Lanka’s economic crisis crosses INR 750 million worldwide
byline: Tourist Family, the debut film of director Abishan Jeevinth, is proving to be 2025’s breakout Tamil hit, crossing an impressive Rs 75 crore at the global box office. Released on May 1, the film has steadily grown in popularity, bolstered by glowing reviews from both the public and the press.

title: Cabinet Spokesman clarifies move to extend state patronage for Malini Fonseka’s funeral
byline: Attention was drawn towards the decision by the government to provide state patronage to perform the final rites of late veteran actress Malini Fonseka, during today’s weekly Cabinet media briefing.

title: ‘Red’ warning for strong winds and rough seas issued
byline: A ‘Red’ alert warning has been issued for strong winds and rough seas for sea areas extending from Chilaw to Kankesanthurai via Puttalam and Mannar and from Galle to Pottuvil via Hambantota.

title: Deadline gazetted for submission of LG members’ lists
byline: The Election Commission has issued an urgent reminder to all political parties and independent groups to submit the names of their elected representatives to local government bodies, including the mandatory female members, before 12.00 midnight on May 30, 2025.

title: Bribery Commission files indictment against Mervyn Silva
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has filed an indictment before the Colombo High Court against former Minister Mervyn Silva.

title: Case filed over misuse of funds by Sarana Gunawardena heard at Colombo HC
byline: The case filed against former Deputy Minister Sarana Gunawardena, who is accused of misappropriating over Rs. 12 million during the period leading up to the 2015 Presidential Election, was taken up for hearing again today (27) at the Colombo High Court.

title: Hearing of case related to SLFP headquarters adjourned
byline: The Court of Appeal today (27) extended the interim injunction issued preventing the examination of a private plaint filed against Chairman of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) former Minister Nimal Siripala de Silva at the Maligakanda Magistrate’s Court until 23 July.

title: Notice on university admission issued by UGC
byline: The deadline for the acceptance of applications for university admission for the academic year 2024/2025, for students who passed the 2024 G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination will end at midnight on 30 May, the University Grants Commission (UGC) has announced.
